channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves on paths, 5th November
item.description:
The paths on Overbury and down Oakwood Ave, need to have the leaves cleared again. I cleared 3 large black bags of leaves from the kerb today as it was difficult to park my little car. If the leaves are not cleared from path they will just blow into kerb again. These roads should be looked at on a weekly basis in Autumn to keep the paths and kerbs clear. It only took me 30 mins to fill 3 bags and I’m 80, post 5 months hip replacement. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overbury Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and littering and overflowing bins, 5th November
item.description:
Constant fly tipping and illegal dumping all along this section of Blurton Road. This spot is constant but the problem is all along the road and is associated with the large number of bins the council think is acceptable to have on the pavement on this rd.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A thick layer of rotting leaves along the curb and on the sidewalk., 5th November
item.description:
A thick layer of rotting leaves has built up along the curb and across the sidewalk, creating a serious hazard. When wet, these leaves become as slippery as ice — one wrong step and someone could easily fall, twisting an ankle or even hitting their head on the pavement. What’s worse, you can’t see what’s hidden underneath them: uneven bricks, sharp debris, or even broken glass. It’s not just unpleasant — it’s genuinely dangerous, especially for children, the elderly, or anyone walking after dark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Haysleigh Gardens, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littery/ rubbish (food etc), 5th November
item.description:
Rats and foxes taking apart. It's on the street since the weekend. Please can someone address this? The street is always so dirty. This has been a constant problem, which is being constantly reported, but not addressed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin issue on Highstreet FIRE RISK, 5th November
item.description:
Hi, Today, there was a trash bin on fire / smoking. I went to the nearest shop (Taco Bell), and got a bucket of water to put this out. Looking at the bin, I can see there is no inside ash tray on the bin.. so this is a fire risk - as cigarettes drop into the trash bin directly. I've informed in person the fire service (walked in). I called Bromley's switch board - I was forwarded to environment and safety department. Press the option more than a few times, and was disconnected... which is a shame as the disclaimer is at least 5mins long - I was never put through to an operator. The bin is right next to one of those xmas wooden huts (not yet open(.. so, it's really not a good place for this to happen. Please replace bin ASAP. Thanks,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123 - 131, High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
